2023.description: Death Timeout was a mod I was commissioned to create that prevents players from joining for 1 hour after they have died.
I created an assembler and VM/interpreter for the custom assembly instruction set that my A-Level specification uses.

I have contributed to the Rust crate 'Pest', which is a parser generator for Rust. I have implemented bug fixes, and recently have been creating a language server and VSCode extension for Pest. Over the next few months I plan on continuing work on Pest, potentially upgrading other aspects of the parser for my own use cases.

2022.description: Bloom is a Deno library for creating and interacting with Bloom filters, a probabilistic data structure.
Dishooks is a Deno library for posting to Discord webhooks.
I created a Deno application that allows you to play Wordle on the CLI.

image.alt: A screenshot of a Wordle-like game running on the CLI.

2022.description: Utility Belt is a mod for the Fabric modloader that allows players to store their tools in an extra hotbar - their tool belt.
Two of my mods were present at BlanketCon, an in-game convention hosted by ModFest and QuiltMC.

image.alt: A screenshot of a large tavern building in Minecraft.

2022.description: I have contributed to Modifold, a Kotlin program that migrates Curseforge projects to Modrinth.
I created a website that allows people to RSVP to a 60s-themed party, via fresh and MongoDB.
PBOSB was a mod I was commissioned to create that makes projectiles bounce off of slime blocks in Minecraft.

title.text: Minecraft but you can Grow Mobs

2022.description: I was commissioned to create this mod for the YouTuber Jagster, which allows you to grow mobs in Minecraft.
I created a library for loading `.properties` files on Deno, supporting an extended version of the syntax that allows defining objects and arrays.
I created a library for loading Improperties, an obscure configuration format. My module was the fist specification compliant parser for Improperties.
Dynamo is a configuration library for Deno and Node applications. It supports loading config files in multiple formats, leaving configuration as the choice of the user.
I contribute to Quilt Mappings, which is a mappings set for decompiling Minecraft. I review pull requests, as well contributing new mappings from time to time.
Sourcecraft is a GitHub-actions based Minecraft decompiler, providing decompiled Minecraft sources for browsing.
'Chat with a daily pen pal, completely anonymously.'; Pigeon Mail is a chat application that pairs you with a pen pal every day, built with Astro for Supabase's hackathon

image.alt: A screenshot of Pigeon Mail's homepage, containing a large world map and the tagline previously mentioned.

2022.description: I forked an out-of-date Minecraft modding library and updated it to newer versions, ported it to Quilt, and added extra features to it.

2021.description: Right Click Harvest is my first and, to date, most downloaded Fabric mod. It provides a QOL feature, allowing players to harvest crops by right clicking.
Reaping is a multiplatform (supporting all 3 major modloaders) Minecraft mod that provides new methods to obtain food.

image.alt: A GIF of an animal being reaped in Minecraft.

2021.description: The YouTuber SocksFor1 commissioned me to create this mod, which adds many different enchantments.
I was commissioned to create this mod for the YouTuber SocksFor1. It generates random storms every 1 minute, such as OP loot or enemies falling from the sky.
Pinguino is a multi-purpose Discord bot written in Kotlin that provides many different modules and functionalities for Discord servers.
Jamtastic is a fun mod for Fabric that adds a jam jar, into which players can put any food in order to make jam from it. Porkchop jam, anyone?

image.alt: A GIF of a player making jam in Minecraft.

2021.description: Doogle was a website I created for a competition. It allows users to vote on a large number of Dogs and stores the result, with the intention of finding the most loved dog breeds. It had a Mongo database, accessed via a Deno-based backend and fresh frontend
I have contributed to QuiltMC's (a modloader) in-house Discord bot a number of times.

2020.description: I was part of a team building a RaspberryPi based robot to complete several challenges. I handled all of the programming and hardware of the robot.
